DOC.brief_title: Safety Effect SANGUINATEâ„¢ Infusion Patients Risk Delayed Cerebral Ischemia ( DCI ) Following Subarachnoid Hemorrhage ( SAH )
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study study safety effect SANGUINATE patient suffer delayed cerebral ischemia acute aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage .
DOC.criteria: Signed date write informed consent subject his/her legally authorize representative ; Modified Rankin ( mRankin ) score 0 1 prior onset subarachnoid hemorrhage ; Ruptured aneurysm secure endovascular coil embolization surgical clipping ( Procedure ) , 72 hour onset subarachnoid hemorrhage ; Hunt Hess ( H & H ) grade 3 4 , World Federation Neurological Surgeons ( WFNS ) score 3 4 prior Procedure , Modified Fisher ( mFisher ) grade 3 4 , prior Procedure ; Clinical sign ( `` symptomatic '' ) delay cerebral ischemia ; Angiographic evidence cerebral vasospasm In judgment Investigator patient good candidate study Evidence rebleed follow Procedure Subarachnoid hemorrhage secondary trauma arteriovenous malformation Diagnosed moderate severe pulmonary hypertension Radiologically confirm moderate severe pulmonary edema ( show presence Kerley line , peribronchial cuffing , thicken interlobar fissure , consolidation and/or pleural effusion ) History within past 6 month and/or find decompensated heart failure Acute myocardial infarction within 3 month prior administration study drug Left ventricular ejection fraction < 40 % , determine prior echocardiography clinical sign CHF Medical history concurrent evidence moderate severe renal insufficiency ( estimate creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min )
